body_html:
I digged a little further and this seems to be caused by compiling the custom op with g++ 5.4.0 on 16.04. Note that the -D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0 flag is correctly present to attempt to use the older ABI.

If I install g++ 4.8 and compile with that the segfault disappears and the op runs correctly.
body_text:
I digged a little further and this seems to be caused by compiling the custom op with g++ 5.4.0 on 16.04.  Note that the -D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0 flag is correctly present to attempt to use the older ABI.
If I install g++ 4.8 and compile with that the segfault disappears and the op runs correctly.
body:
I digged a little further and this seems to be caused by compiling the custom op with g++ 5.4.0 on 16.04.  Note that the `-D_GLIBCXX_USE_CXX11_ABI=0` flag is correctly present to attempt to use the older ABI.

If I install g++ 4.8 and compile with that the segfault disappears and the op runs correctly.
